page.title: 16Recreation Field/Darras Hall
page.content: {"Recreation Field"(The Flush)} This is an oval-shaped area of 10 acres, being the only designated open space on the estate. There is a small football pitch but most of the space is grassland and shrubs. To protect it from housing development, it has recently been created a{Site of {Special Scientific Interest,}being one of the few remaining areas of semi-natural grassland in the county- noted for several plant species uncommon in{Northumberland. } There is a conflict of interest between those residents who wish to have more recreational facilities such as a B.M.X.track and those who wish the natural habitat to remain. Local schools use it for walks and nature study occasionally...there being a good selection of wild flowers.
